body.name: Gotham Steel 5 Quart Stock Pot Multipurpose Pasta Pot with Strainer Lid & Twist and Lock Handles, Nonstick Cooking Pot + Pasta Strainer Pot with Lid, Spaghetti Pot, Oven/Dishwasher Safe - CREAM

features: GOTHAM STEEL MULTIPURPOSE PASTA POT: Great for pasta, spaghettis and anything else that cooks on the stove! Use the strainer or not, this pot is designed for all types of foods and is oven safe & dishwasher safe. The Gotham Steel nonstick coating is composed of ceramic and reinforced with titanium, ensuring this frying pan free of PFOA, PFOS, lead & cadmium for an eco-friendly, healthy experience for your entire family

THE ULTIMATE KITCHEN GADGET: The Gotham Steel Pasta Pot is 3 kitchen gadgets combined into a single pot. The 1st kitchen gadget included is the strainer lid- Strain your pasta with the built in strainer lid, no need for a colander. The 2nd kitchen gadget included are twist and lock handles- Keep your hands safe with the Gotham Steel Pasta Pot's twist and lock handles. Lastly, get rid of all the sticky situations, food comes right out of the Gotham Steel Pasta pot with the ultra-nonstick ceramic coating.

TWIST & LOCK HANDLES: Strain out water seconds - simply twist the handles and drain out the water - no strainer needed! Also includes 2 different straining sizes for fine and thicker foods, ensuring nothing slips out while straining.

ULTIMATE CERAMIC NONSTICK: The Gotham Steel nonstick cooking surface is coated three times and then reinforced with diamonds to deliver the ultimate food release. No seasoning or even oil or butter needed, makes for healthier eating, and provides for hassle free, 1-2-3 cleanup.
EFFORTLESS CLEANUP, DISHWASHER SAFE: Spend less time with cleanup! After all the cooking and prepping is done, place cookware in the dishwasher for quick and easy cleanup.

METAL UTENSIL SAFE: The coating of the pan is infused with diamonds, the strongest material on earth which makes it durable enough to withstand metal utensils, spatulas, spoons, whisks and even electric beaters while delivering years of outstanding, nonstick use

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: POUR IN SECONDS! With the Gotham Steel Pasta Pot, You can pour out pasta, potatoes, soaps and more with ease! The stay cool handles and unique pouring spout help create an unforgettable experience never imaged with cooking pots before! CLEANUP IS EFFORTLESS! The Gotham Steel Proprietary Ti-Cerama Coating ensures easy and quick wipe downs of foods and sticky sauces, making cleanup a breeze! USE AS A REGULAR COOKING POT! Cook pasta, soups, french fries, potates and more with the Gotham Steel Pasta Pot. This super versatile cooking pot is great for every kitchen need all the way from pasta to vegetables!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Fabulous addition to my kitchen!
reviews.reviewText: Such a handy pot! Loving it! So easy to clean and store! The strainer feature is my favorite! Sturdy and heavy but not too heavy! Perfect!!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 26, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Needed smaller pot. It was a bonus that water can be drained directly through the lid. We have used this pot more than the expensive one we have.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works well as advertised
reviews.reviewText: I have used this pot to cook spaghetti and soup several times now. It's great to be able drain the water off and the spaghetti tastes better this way. This pot is sturdy and easy to clean. Another winner for Gotham!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 19, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Functional Ceramic Nonstick Pot With Strainer Lid and Locking Handle Assist. Plastic Handles
reviews.reviewText: This review is for the GOTHAM STEEL Ceramic Nonstick Pot with Lid (Color - Cream White, Capacity - 5 Quarts). I received a free taxable sample of this pot to review in my search for functional nonstick cookware.The pot arrived wrapped in a branded and decorated cardboard sleeve with a set of instructions taped to the sleeve. If gifting this pot, I recommend placing it in a gift bag with a tag and tissue paper. The pot is fairly thin and lightweight at 788 grams and has a circular base of 8" that then rises 5" to an outer diameter of 8 3/4". There are two small protruding spouts on opposite ends of the top rim, and the bottom of the pot has a circular grooved disc of shiny metal that appears to be aluminum. The handles are an interesting mostly plastic construction attached to short metal arms secured to the sides of the pot and which have a twisting knob mechanism that secures the lid in place. The accompanying lid weighs 458 grams and measures 8 1/2" in diameter on the bottom rim with a depth of 1" and a top diameter of 9 1/4". There is a metal handle set into the top of the lid that rises 1" from the glass top. Two sizes (11x medium, 24x small) of strainer hole groups are built into opposite ends of the lid which roughly measure 2" x 3/4".As tested, the nonstick properties of the pot were quite good with an easy release for food and the overall capacity at the brim was 5 quarts. I was surprised by the lighter weight of the pot, but so far it has heated up quite easily and durability of the metal portions has not been a concern. Based on experience with other ceramic cookware, my only concern about the ceramic is that it will turn slightly off color and lose most of its nonstick properties over time. My other concern is for the plastic handles which I'm not sure will hold up to a direct flame even though the digital product literature suggests that this is oven safe (which I did not put to the test). My main dislikes for the handles are their thin clicky noise and somewhat cheap feel as I would have preferred metal handles with a more solid feel. Outside of those concerns, I did like the convenience of having the two sizes of strainer holes built into the lid as well as the option to not use the lid for straining (for noodles, I typically use a stainless-steel spaghetti server). The drainage speed isn't exactly the fastest, so I would recommend first pouring out the bulk of the liquid without the lid and then using the lid to strain the final portion.All in all, this pot is quite sturdy with a nice look and good nonstick functionality. I recommend this as a decent option for a functional nonstick ceramic pot, but also recommend seeing if there are similar options with metal handles.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Bottom of pan buckles when heated
reviews.reviewText: This is a very clever pot because the handles lock and you can drain your pasta easily but it doesn't function well for other types of cooking. I sauteed vegetables for a soup and the bottom of the pot buckled and now it doesn't sit flat on the stove.
